extendedIngredients.name: broccoli rabe

extendedIngredients.name: cannellini beans
extendedIngredients.original: 1 15-ounce can cannellini (white kidney beans), rinsed, drained

extendedIngredients.original: 8 ounces ditalini or other short tube-shaped pasta (about 2 cups)

title: Ditalini with Pesto, Beans, and Broccoli Rabe
summary: Ditalini with Pesto, Beans, and Broccoli Rabe might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe makes 4 servings with 611 calories, 23g of protein, and 20g of fat each. For $2.41 per serving, this recipe covers 28% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. If you have broccoli rabe, cannellini, purchased pesto, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is brought to you by Epicurious. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a vegan diet. Overall, this recipe earns an outstanding spoonacular score of 83%. Try Broccoli Rabe Pesto Bruschetta, Orecchiette with Broccoli Rabe Pesto, and Burrata with Broccoli Rabe Pesto and Fig-Onion Jam for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

instructions: Preparation                                                        Cook pasta in large pot of boiling salted water 3 minutes. Add broccoli rabe and boil until broccoli rabe is just crisp-tender and pasta is just tender but still firm to bite, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes longer. Drain pasta and broccoli rabe, reserving 1/2 cup cooking liquid. Return pasta and broccoli rabe to pot.                                                                Meanwhile, bring vegetable broth and crushed red pepper to simmer in medium saucepan. Add beans and simmer until beans are heated through, stirring frequently, about 5 minutes.  Add bean mixture, pesto, and vinegar to pasta and broccoli rabe. Stir well, adding pasta cooking liquid by tablespoonfuls if necessary. Season with salt and pepper. Serve in shallow bowls.

steps.step: Cook pasta in large pot of boiling salted water 3 minutes.
Add broccoli rabe and boil until broccoli rabe is just crisp-tender and pasta is just tender but still firm to bite, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes longer.
Drain pasta and broccoli rabe, reserving 1/2 cup cooking liquid. Return pasta and broccoli rabe to pot.
Meanwhile, bring vegetable broth and crushed red pepper to simmer in medium saucepan.
Add beans and simmer until beans are heated through, stirring frequently, about 5 minutes.
Add bean mixture, pesto, and vinegar to pasta and broccoli rabe. Stir well, adding pasta cooking liquid by tablespoonfuls if necessary. Season with salt and pepper.
